articles.content:
S. Korean authorities crack down on unionists
    Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities on May 7 suppressed members of the executive committee of the Seoul Subway Trade Union on charges of the violation of an evil law, a Seoul-based radio reported.
   They dismissed 24 persons including the trade union chairman and released two others from office for the mere reason that they took the lead in the recent strike of the trade union.
   This is a retaliation of the authorities for the just struggle of workers for the right to existence.

articles.content:
Move to strengthen riot police in S. Korea
      Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The self-proclaimed people's government of South Korea and the National Congress for New Politics at a party and government negotiation on May 8 decided to set up a state police committee and place it under the prime minister's office, a Seoul-based radio said. 
    The national police office now under the Ministry of Administrative Autonomy is reportedly presumed to be instructed by the committee in the future.
    This step to put police under the command of the prime minister is in essence a criminal move to strengthen riot police.

articles.content:
Five-point policy of great national unity supported
   Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Member of the Rajya Sabha  of India Das Gupta Biprav released a press statement on May 7 on the occasion of the first anniversary of the advancement of the five-point policy of great national unity by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.   
   In the statement he said that the five-point policy of great national unity put forth by Kim Jong Il fully reflects his steadfast determination and will to surely achieve the country's reunification by defending and carrying forward the idea and exploits and rich experience and traditions of great national unity, the noblest patriotic legacies left by the President Kim Il Sung.
   With the five-point policy  the solid foundation was laid to smash the obstructive moves of the separatists, firmly build up the driving forces of national reunification and accelerate it.

articles.title: S. Korean authorities must not act foolishly
articles.content:
Projected moves to frustrate 2nd strike of KCTU
   Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The supreme public prosecutor's office of South Korea on May 8 revealed its attempt to crack down again on a second round of the strike of the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), according to a news report from Seoul.   
   The South Korean ruling quarters announced that in order to prevent the KCTU's struggle beforehand they would arrest all the members of its leadership and leading members of trade unions under it who will participate in the strike, and punish them on charges of violation of the evil law.
   They are also scheming to dismiss all the Seoul Subway trade union strikers in case they go on a strike again.
